vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
σκληρ-ύνω,
harden, opposed to μαλάσσω, [Refs 5th c.BC+]:—passive, with perfect ἐσκλήρυσμαι [Refs 5th c.BC+], to be hardened, grow hard, [Refs 4th c.BC+]
__2 metaphorically, σ. τὴν καρδίαν τινός harden his heart, [LXX+NT]:—passive, [LXX]
vocabInfos.shortDef: to harden (the heart), make obstinate, make stubborn; (passive) to be hardened, become obstinate
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
to harden (the heart), make obstinate, make stubborn; (passive) to be hardened, become obstinate
to harden;, metaphorically to harden morally, to make stubborn, obstinate Heb. 3:8, 15; 4:7; as a negation of ἐλεειν, to leave to stubbornness and contumacy, Rom. 9:18; middle and passive to put on a stubborn frame, Acts 19:9; Heb. 3:13*
